result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence C Allison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence C Allison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrence C Allison in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to County ordinance section 24.01, a Class forfeiture.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 12-14-2015 or Civil Judgment.

Defendant Terrence C Allison in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defendant needs to complete community service and get new offer from the state.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence C Allison in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needing to review discovery.  Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date received and filed with court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Terrence C Allison in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Terrence C Allison in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge SIEFERT.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge DEE, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
